Description: In a desolate landscape, a lion dramatically confronts a snake. In a letter to a patron, Barye identified the lion as coming from Senegal. The sculptor, late in life, has returned to a subject that he had first explored in sculpture in 1832-33.

Exhibitions.ExhTitle: Untamed: The Art of Antoine-Louis Barye
Exhibitions.Textblock: Untamed: The Art of Antoine-Louis Barye. The Walters Art Museum, Baltimore; Philbrook Museum of Art, Tulsa; The Henry Morrison Flagler Museum, Palm Beach. 2007-2008.

Exhibitions.ExhTitle: The Essence of Line: French Drawings from Ingres to Degas
Exhibitions.Textblock: The Essence of Line: French Drawings from Ingres to Degas. The Walters Art Museum, Baltimore; Baltimore Museum of Art, Baltimore; Birmingham Museum of Art, Birmingham; Tacoma Art Museum, Tacoma. 2005-2006.
The Works of Antoine-Louis Barye. American Art Gallery (New York), New York. 1889-1890.

Exhibitions.ExhTitle: The Wild Kingdom of Antoine-Louis Barye, 1795-1875
Exhibitions.Textblock: The Wild Kingdom of Antoine-Louis Barye, 1795-1875. Wildenstein & Company, New York. 1994.

Exhibitions.ExhTitle: A Baltimorean in Paris: George A. Lucas, 1860-1909
Exhibitions.Textblock: A Baltimorean in Paris: George A. Lucas, 1860-1909. The Walters Art Gallery, Baltimore. 1979.

Exhibitions.ExhTitle: From Rye to Raphael: The Walters Story
Exhibitions.Textblock: From Rye to Raphael: The Walters Story. The Walters Art Museum, Baltimore; The Walters Art Museum, Baltimore; The Walters Art Museum, Baltimore; The Walters Art Museum, Baltimore; The Walters Art Museum, Baltimore; The Walters Art Museum, Baltimore. 2014-2016.

Inscriptions:
"BARYE" in brown watercolor on left bottom edge, recto; "P7-491/a" in dark brown ink at center, verso
[Signature] Painted in brown watercolor on left bottom edge on recto: BARYE; [Number] Written in dark brown ink at center on verso: PJ-491/a.
Keywords: animal; Python; snake; lion; cat; feline
Medium: watercolor on heavily textured, thick, cream wove paper
Provenance: William T. Walters, Baltimore, December 23, 1863, by purchase; Henry Walters, Baltimore, 1894, by inheritance; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Title: Lion and Python
